title: Puttu kudam Puttu maker

  physical_appearance: The image displays a puttu maker. It comprises of a pot as its base
 with five tubes at the top. These five tubes can be detached from its base. All of the five tubes are wrapped with cloth and have ropes tied around them.

  subject_terms_1: cooking utensils implements (object genre) kitchenware

  subject_terms_2: Food steamers Kitchen utensils Steaming (Cooking)

  subject_terms_3: Indian food

  sgcool_label_text: This puttu maker is of highly unusual design
 comprising of a brass pot
 with five bamboo inserts. Puttu is a popular breakfast/snack in Kerala
 made of a mix of steamed broken rice and grated coconut. The mix of rice and coconut would be stuffed into the bamboo tubes
 and then steamed by heating the water in the pot.

metadata.physical_appearance: The image displays a puttu maker. It comprises of a pot as its base, with five tubes at the top. These five tubes can be detached from its base. All of the five tubes are wrapped with cloth and have ropes tied around them.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This puttu maker is of highly unusual design, comprising of a brass pot, with five bamboo inserts. Puttu is a popular breakfast/snack in Kerala, made of a mix of steamed broken rice and grated coconut. The mix of rice and coconut would be stuffed into the bamboo tubes, and then steamed by heating the water in the pot.
